headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  GUIDA, PETER M.

snippet: GUIDA--Peter M.,M.D. The Department of Surgery mourns the loss of our distinguished colleague, Dr. Peter M. Guida, Associate Professor of Surgery and Associate Attending Surgeon at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital and Weill Cornell Medical Center for more than 60 years before retiring in 2005. Dr. Guida received his MD from Albany Medical College in 1954 and served as an intern and resident in general surgery at The New York Hospital. An outstanding teacher and mentor to medical students and surgical residents, he performed the first aortic aneurysm and the first open-heart surgery at The New York Hospital. In recognition of his clinical and academic expertise, he was asked to found the Division of Cardiac, Vascular and Thoracic Surgery at New York Hospital and Cornell College of Medicine. We extend our deepest condolences to his wife Bernadette and to his family. He will be sorely missed. Fabrizio Michelassi, M.D. Lewis Atterbury Stimson Professor of Surgery Chairman, Department of Surgery Surgeon-in-Chief NewYork-Presbyterian/ Weill Cornell Medical Center 1/3
